result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrell L Jefferson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $6616.00 payable to Bank Mutual  (joint and several to Jordan Novak and Darionta Phifer). 
All mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); Court WAIVED non-mandatory costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obilgations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Consecutive to: with 1041 days credit, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
*** Corrected Judgment of Conviction to fix clerical error and to now relfect correct sentence credit of 1041 days. Original Judgment of Conviction stated 1044 days credit.****

superMiscConds.notes: - Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- No contact with Prime Financial, Melissa M., Great Midwest Bank, Joanne L., CVS Pharmacy, Bank Mutual, Jordan N., Laquan M., Darionta Phifer (co-actor), and Jacquelle J.

supervisions.notes:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of PLEA AND SENTENCING transcript commencing 12/08/2016 received and filed. (38 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Public Defender Appointment, District Attorney, and Institution.
Letter received from DOC, received and filed.
Letter from DOC regarding sentence credit listed in judgment of conviction.

Sentencing proceeded. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 144 MONTHS with 1041 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 72 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 72MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No firearms, ammunition, body armor or no voting until rights have been restored.
- Obtain/maintain employment/education or combination of both.
- No contact with Prime Financial, Melissa M., Great Midwest Bank, Joanne L., CVS Pharmacy, Bank Mutual, Jordan N., Laquan M., Darionta Phifer (co-actor), and Jacquelle J.:
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $6616.00 payable to Bank Mutual  (joint and several to Jordan Novak and Darionta Phifer). 
All mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); Court WAIVED non-mandatory costs.
All applicable fees of supervision.
- Court ordered that all mandatory court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection from any court ordered obilgations from the defendant's prison funds in an amount or percentage determined by DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

20 day appeal rights given,

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Tyrell L Jefferson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Tyrell L Jefferson in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon hee may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

AS TO COUNT 2:

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
